required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Pilot Study on Antioxidant Uptake and Downstream Effects

brief_summary.textblock: A small cross-over trial on 3 different doses of liposomal vitamin C, comparing vitamin C uptake and downstream effects when 24 people consume 1, 2, and 5 grams on different test days, compared to placebo.

detailed_description.textblock: A randomized, cross-over study design will be used to evaluate the effects of consumption of 4 different doses of liposomal vitamin C (0, 1, 2, and 5 grams). The study is of 5 weeks' duration, with evaluation of a different dose at each of week 1, week 3 and week 5 with a one week washout between each dose.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Randomized, placebo-controlled, single blind, cross-over trial

other_outcome.measure: Evaluation of downstream effects reflecting antioxidant protection

arm_group.description: Participants will consume 1 gram on study day
Participants will consume 2 grams on study day
Participants will consume 5 grams on study day
Participants will consume placebo on study day

intervention.description: after a blood draw 1 gram of vitamin c will be consumed followed by 3 additional blood draws
after a blood draw 2 grams of vitamin c will be consumed followed by 3 additional blood draws
after a blood draw 5 grams of vitamin c will be consumed followed by 3 additional blood draws
after a blood draw placebo will be consumed followed by 3 additional blood draws
